text: state media in syria say at least 14
people have been killed in a bomb attack
on a bus carrying soldiers in the
capital damascus
two devices are reported to have
exploded as the vehicle crossed a bridge
in the heart of the city during rush
hour a third device was defused just
hours after the attack a syrian army
shelled a residential area in idlib
province held by rebel fighters
witnesses and rescue workers say at
least 11 civilians there were killed
including several school children on one
of the bloodiest days in syria in months
let's go live to our correspondent anna
foster who's in beirut in neighbouring
lebanon anna first of all to what
happened in damascus what do we know so
far
well as you say those pictures have
emerged from rush hour this morning in
the very heart of damascus it's
important to point out that this is
right in the center of the city at a
time when people were heading to work
children were heading to school and this
was a military bus carrying soldiers now
it would appear at this stage and
details are still very limited but it
would appear that this was a planned
attack two explosive devices went off
very close to that bus as it passed by a
third one as you mentioned was located
and diffused by military engineers now
all of this details so far has come from
the syrian state news agency they call
this a terrorist attack
it is vital really and important in the
context of all of this to note that
attacks like this are very rare in
damascus itself the last one of this
size was probably nearly five years ago
or so
as you know syria is a fragmented
country different parts of it are
controlled some by the syrian regime
some by rebels and when you look at
damascus it is important for president
assad and for the regime to try and
maintain damascus very much as a
stronghold and this is something which
has been breached this morning
and which will certainly attract
attention as you say and anna so far we
believe no claim of responsibility for
that by any group but what happened a
couple of hours later in idlib just tell
us more about what the syrian army did
there
that's right so as you say while nobody
has claimed responsibility for this we
can look at some of the other things
that have gone on in the aftermath this
morning and around about an hour
afterwards we're told that in ariha city
which is a residential area of idlib
rebel hell did lib of course
whether the syrian regime would like to
hold that piece of territory that part
of syria but don't we're told that
syrian army outposts shelled a reha city
in idlib we're told around about seven
people injured rescue workers say as you
mentioned that school children were
among the casualties there now it's too
early to
put a direct correlation between these
two attacks but the suggestion is
certainly that one may possibly have
been in retaliation for the other
it's more than 10 years anna since the
start of the war in syria just to give
us a sense of how much fighting still
goes on around the country
well if you look at idlib in particular
you will see that there is this ongoing
tussle between different groups for
control of that particular area damascus
as i was saying is is relatively
peaceful relatively secure but if you
look down in the south for example in
the rest of area of dhara there's been
rebel and syrian regime fighting there
are still huge swathes of syria of
course where small remnants of the
islamic state group are still working
still trying to cause trouble around
there as well so even more than a decade
after the war in syria began things
there are still far from peaceful
anna thank you very much anna foster
with the latest they're monitoring
events from beirut in neighbouring
lebanon
